title: 1 Dead, Child Among 3 Injured In Vallejo Shooting; Suspect At Large
content:
VALLEJO (CBS SF) — One person was killed and three others were injured in a shooting on Porter Street in Vallejo Friday afternoon, a police lieutenant said.
The shooting happened around 3:50 p.m. in a residential area at Porter and McLane streets. One of the injured who went to a hospital is a nine-year-old child. The adult victim was dead at the scene.
The child had a head wound that police believe was caused by a bullet. One of the adults injured was wounded in the hand. Police said the injured were expected to survive.
The victims were found in a black Monte Carlo in a driveway at 509 Porter Street and the suspects drove by and fled in a maroon sedan, according to Lt. Kevin Bartlett.
